docs.abstract: Argentine province turns away two Carnival cruise ships, the latest salvo in Argentina’s dispute with Great Britain over the Falkland Islands; ships had stopped in the Falklands en route to Chile.

headline.main: Argentina: 2 British Cruise Ships Are Turned Away From Port
headline.print_headline: Argentina: 2 British Cruise Ships Are Turned Away From Port

docs.snippet: An Argentine province turned away two Carnival cruise ships on Monday, the latest salvo in Argentina’s dispute with Britain over the Falkland Islands.
docs.lead_paragraph: An Argentine province turned away two Carnival cruise ships on Monday, the latest salvo in Argentina’s dispute with Britain over the Falkland Islands.

docs.abstract: Argentine government instructs 20 leading Argentine companies to stop importing British products and supplies, in the hope of pressuring Britain to negotiate over the future of the Falkland Islands.

headline.main: Argentina: Halting British Imports to Try to Force Falklands Talks
headline.print_headline: Argentina: Halting British Imports To Try to Force Falklands Talks

docs.snippet: The government on Tuesday told 20 leading Argentine companies to stop importing British products and supplies, in the hope that it would press Britain to negotiate over the future of the Falkland Islands.
docs.lead_paragraph: The government on Tuesday told 20 leading Argentine companies to stop importing British products and supplies, in the hope that it would press Britain to negotiate over the future of the Falkland Islands.

docs.abstract: President Obama and Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain, in joint press conference, pledge to adhere to the timetable for winding down the war in Afghanistan by the end of 2014; also address concerns about the Middle East, affirming the need to allow economic sanctions to take their toll before considering military action in Iran; they appear united on Syria, but their solid front appears to be born of frustration.

headline.seo: Obama and Cameron Stand United on Afghanistan
headline.main: Cameron and Obama Show Unity on Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: Obama and Cameron Present United Front on Afghanistan, Iran and Syria

docs.snippet: President Obama and Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain addressed concerns in the Middle East and said they would stick by their timetable for Afghanistan.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama and Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain addressed concerns in the Middle East and said they would stick by their timetable for Afghanistan.

docs.abstract: Argentine government has finally made public a critical report of the mistakes made by its military dictatorship in its war against Britain over the Falkland Islands in 1982.

headline.main: Argentina: Report on 1982 War With Britain Is Declassified
headline.print_headline: Argentina: Report on 1982 War With Britain Is Declassified

docs.snippet: The government has finally made public a critical report of the mistakes made by its military dictatorship in its war against Britain to recover the Falkland Islands in 1982
docs.lead_paragraph: The government has finally made public a critical report of the mistakes made by its military dictatorship in its war against Britain to recover the Falkland Islands in 1982

docs.abstract: Summit meeting of Western Hemisphere nations ends, failing to issue consensus statement amid disagreements over whether to continue to exclude Cuba from future meetings.

headline.seo: Summit of Americas Meeting Ends Without Consensus Statement
headline.main: Americas Meeting Ends With Discord Over Cuba
headline.print_headline: Americas Meeting Ends With Discord Over Cuba

byline.original: By JACKIE CALMES and WILLIAM NEUMAN

docs.snippet: Western Hemisphere nations failed to issue a consensus statement amid disagreements over whether to let Cuba join future summit meetings.
docs.lead_paragraph: Western Hemisphere nations failed to issue a consensus statement amid disagreements over whether to let Cuba join future summit meetings.

headline.main: Falkland Islands: Government Plans Referendum on Islands’ Status
headline.print_headline: Falkland Islands: Government Plans Referendum on Islands’ Status

docs.snippet: The Falkland Islands government has planned a referendum next year, seeking to end Argentina’s claims of sovereignty and to secure the Falklands’ status as a British territory.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Falkland Islands government has planned a referendum next year, seeking to end Argentina’s claims of sovereignty and to secure the Falklands’ status as a British territory.

docs.abstract: Claude Cheysson, outspoken foreign minister in socialist government of French Pres Francois Mitterrand in 1980s, dies at age 92.

headline.seo: Claude Cheysson, French Ex-Foreign Minister, Dies at 92
headline.main: Claude Cheysson, Candid French Foreign Minister, Dies at 92
headline.print_headline: Claude Cheysson, 92, Candid French Foreign Minister

docs.snippet: As an outspoken foreign minister in the socialist government of François Mitterrand in the 1980s, Mr. Cheysson barreled into difficult issues with often undiplomatic zeal.
docs.lead_paragraph: As an outspoken foreign minister in the socialist government of François Mitterrand in the 1980s, Mr. Cheysson barreled into difficult issues with often undiplomatic zeal.

docs.abstract: Sir Rex Hunt, symbol of British defiance in the Falkland Islands war in 1982, dies at age 86.

headline.main: Sir Rex Hunt, Symbol of British Defiance in the Windswept Falklands, Dies at 86
headline.print_headline: Sir Rex Hunt, Symbol of British Defiance In the Windswept Falklands, Dies at 86

docs.snippet: In 1982, Sir Rex found himself, literally overnight, directing a tiny band of British military men against an amphibious Argentine invasion.
docs.lead_paragraph: In 1982, Sir Rex found himself, literally overnight, directing a tiny band of British military men against an amphibious Argentine invasion.

docs.abstract: Publication of British government papers show that Prime Min Margaret Thatcher and Pres Ronald Reagan, who agreed on many issues, butted heads over Britain's 1982 Falklands war with Argentina; papers have added spice to what was previously known about rocky patches in their relationship.

headline.seo: Falklands War Caused Rare Friction for Thatcher and Reagan
headline.main: Papers Show Rare Friction for Thatcher and Reagan
headline.print_headline: Papers Show Rare Friction For Thatcher And Reagan

docs.snippet: Margaret Thatcher and Ronald Reagan agreed on many issues, but newly published documents show how the two strong allies butted heads over Britain’s 1982 Falklands war with Argentina.
docs.lead_paragraph: Margaret Thatcher and Ronald Reagan agreed on many issues, but newly published documents show how the two strong allies butted heads over Britain’s 1982 Falklands war with Argentina.
